laboratory_examinations.findings: Significantly decreased expression of serotonin (5-HT2A) receptors throughout A.M.'s brain.

At baseline, the patient exhibited significantly increased functional connectivity between the medial prefrontal cortex and superior frontal gyrus as well as between the anterior cingulate cortex and the precuneus.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Differences no longer detectable 200 minutes and 1 day after ketamine infusion, but altered SAN-precuneus connectivity was again evident after 7 days.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Score of 43 on the MADRS indicating severe depression.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: 73% reduction in MADRS score 50 minutes after ketamine infusion.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Score of 54 on the BDI indicating severe depression.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: 65% reduction in BDI score 170 minutes after ketamine infusion.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Score of 21 indicating severe suicidal ideation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Score dropped to 13 on the C-SSRS 200 minutes after infusion.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Score of 24 on the CADSS indicating peak dissociative symptoms.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Dissociative symptoms vanished after 130 minutes (score of 2 on the CADSS).
